The 24 Dec 1986 DV production chart stated that principal photography began 11 Nov 1986 in New York City. According to the 11 Aug 1987 NYT, the film was financed for "less than $10 million” by Rush Productions, a successful rap artist management company owned by Russell Simmons.

Although an article in the 14 Dec 1986 LAT stated that the film was planned to open in summer 1987, the 14 Sep 1988 Var noted the film would be released 16 Sep 1988 in the following East Coast cities: New York City; Baltimore, MD; Norfolk, VA; Philadelphia, PA; Richmond, VA, and Washington, DC. The picture would then open 7 Oct 1988 in Atlanta, GA; Buffalo, NY; Chicago, IL; Cleveland, OH; New Orleans, LA; and in Nov 1988 in Los Angeles, CA. However, the 16 Sep 1988 LAT reported that Tougher Than Leather was pulled from New York City theaters “after police told theater officials extra security guards would be needed” following a murder during a rap concert at Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, NY. Showings of the film were also shut down in Philadelphia after fights and violence broke out at a theater, as noted in the 20 Sep 1988 LAT.

After being released from prison, rapper DMC of the hip-hop group, Run DMC, reunites with his band mates, rapper Run and DJ Jam Master Jay, in New York City. Later, Bernie, a talent scout for Strut Productions, approaches the band’s manager, Russell, about signing Run DMC for a tour. Arriving at the Strut Productions office, Russell meets with Bernie and his boss, Arthur. Although Arthur is not interested in the group, Vic, the company’s investor, convinces him to sign them. Later, Run, DMC, and Jam Master Jay learn that their friend, “Runny Ray,” lost his job. Wanting to help, Run offers Ray the job of group assistant. As Run DMC prepares for their tour, they are unaware that Strut Productions is a business front Vic uses to launder money for the drug syndicate run by his father, Marty. Vic learns from Marty that Arthur’s assistant, Jerry, is stealing money from Strut Productions. Backstage during a Run DMC performance, Vic executes Jerry, but Runny Ray accidentally witnesses the murder. Vic kills Ray and orders his henchman, Nathan, to place drugs around Jerry and Ray’s bodies to make it look like a drug deal that ended in murder. Police assume Ray and Bernie shot each other. However, Run, DMC, and Jay believe their friend was framed. Breaking into Strut Productions, they find the offices empty. With the help of Strut’s former receptionist, Pam, the group finds Bernie and learns that Vic murdered Ray. Wanting revenge, Bernie offers to lead the group to Vic’s girl friend, Charlotte. However, Nathan kills Bernie. Getting information on Charlotte’s whereabouts from Pam, Run and Jay track her down, and seek her help capturing Vic inside her apartment. However, Nathan appears and takes Jay hostage. At an abandoned warehouse, Run and DMC bring Vic to exchange for Jay. As Jay and Vic walk toward each other, Charlotte shuts off the power. Grabbing a gun, Jay pushes Vic aside and kills Nathan. Afterward, Vic refuses to confess that he killed Jerry and Runny Ray. Run shoots Vic in the head. Later, Run, DMC, and Jay track down Arthur and convince him to tell police that their friend Ray was innocent.
